p: Like weaving, this approach resonates with Ivan Illich’s work on learning webs,(30) through which he argues that learning requires unlearning the ways in which our bodies and minds have been schooled and tamed. The un-taming of the schools under the HIC umbrella in Latin America through sentipensar practices should not be confused with the development of empathy, but rather with radical ways to see the world, to break with deeply learnt forms of oppression and control that inadvertently travel from our bodies into our homes, neighbourhoods, public spaces and cities. Here, sentipensar practices activate new forms of caring and conviviality. This approach is also clearly expressed in the Barrio Intercultural, where the neighbourhood is conceived, built and lived as a place for mutuality and conviviality.
